result.execSummary:
The defendant Marlon A Neal was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Must report to Probation by close of business today, May 18, 2018.

miscConds.notes:
$1,000.00 cash bond applied and balance refunded to whoever posted it.
If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
If unemployed or underemployed, must seek work at 5 places per week and submit list monthly to the Child Support Agency.

Must pay monthly child support payment in full and on time through WI SCTF.
Must pay monthly on arrears (if ordered) in full and on time through WI SCTF.

Must notify the Child Support Agency of any change of address and/or employment within 48 hours.
Order for DNA given to the defendant in court. Must report to the Barron County Jail on Friday, May 18, 2018, between 1:00 and 5:00 PM, to submit DNA sample.

supervisions.notes: Court grants Huber and good time.
